intro: Caesalpinia nipensis, commonly known as the red torch tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and bright red, flame-like inflorescences that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Its striking appearance and adaptability contribute to its use in landscaping and as a specimen plant.
